author: Igor Bonifacic
title: US airlines warn C-Band 5G could cause 'catastrophic disruption'
description:
The airline industry claims a “catastrophic” event could unfold on Wednesday when AT&T and Verizon activate their new C-Band 5G networks. In a letter obtained by Reuters
, the CEOs of several prominent passenger and cargo airlines, including Delta, United an…

author: Shoshana Wodinsky
title: AT&T, Verizon Delay Their 5G Rollout Plans Over Fears of Airline Interference
description: On Sunday, AT&T and Verizon heartily rejected requests from the U.S. government to delay the rollout of their 5G wireless services on the grounds that the tech could interfere with nearby airliners. Now, just a day later, it looks like the telco giants are re…

author: David McCabe
title: Verizon and AT&T Agree to Delay 5G Plans Over Airline Safety Concerns
description: The companies will wait two weeks and work with the government.

author: Samuel Contreras
title: Verizon updates 5G plans as Ultra Wideband reaches 100 million this month
description:
What you need to know


Verizon's Ultra Wideband mmWave 5G has reached 100 million people covered in 1,700 cities with C-band launching later in January.
Verizon has updated its unlimited plans with more premium data and hotspot data though, Ultra Wideband da…

author: Reuters Editorial
title: AT&T, Verizon will delay some 5G deployment - Reuters.com
description: AT&T and Verizon Communications on Tuesday agreed to temporarily defer turning on some wireless towers near key airports to avert a significant disruption to U.S. flights. This report produced by Freddie Joyner.

author: Reuters Editorial
title: AT&T, Verizon will delay some 5G deployment - Reuters
description: AT&T and Verizon Communications on Tuesday agreed to temporarily defer turning on some wireless towers near key airports to avert a significant disruption to U.S. flights.

author: Reuters Editorial
title: Verizon, AT&T to delay 5G deployment - Reuters
description: Verizon and AT&T said late on Monday they had agreed to a two-week delay in deploying C-Band wireless spectrum, averting an aviation safety standoff that threatened to disrupt flights starting this week.  Flora Bradley-Watson reports.

title: Verizon will limit some 5G deployment near airports - Reuters
description: Verizon Communications (VZ.N) said Tuesday it would temporarily limit some 5G deployment around airports, in a move aimed at averting a major aviation safety crisis.

title: Verizon's fast C-Band 5G is live with high speeds and improved coverage
description:
Verizon Ultra Wideband test on mmWave

What you need to know


C-band 5G has joined mmWave in Verizon's Ultra Wideband 5G coverage with 90 million covered on Wednesday, January 19.

title: Verizon and T-Mobile Discontinue iPad Rebate Program Following Widespread Customer Complaints
description:
Verizon and T-Mobile have discontinued their iPad rebate program in partnership with Apple following widespread customer complaints that the program was ineffective, flawed, and rarely worked as intended.

title: AT&T and Verizon Communications reject request from Pete Buttigieg and the Federal Aviation Administration to delay 5G launch in the US
description: "The question of whether 5G operations can safely coexist with aviation has long been settled," the CEOs of AT&T and Verizon said in a memo on Sunday.

author: Mat Smith
title: The Morning After: Apple closes education discount loophole
description: Apple has finally closed a loophole in the US that allowed most buyers to claim education pricing, even if they weren't actually a student or a teacher. First noted on Reddit, the US Apple Store now requires buyers to verify their status via UNiDAYS to be abl…

author: gdean@insider.com (Grace Dean)
title: The president of Emirates says the 5G rollout that led to flights being canceled is 'one of the most delinquent, utterly irresponsible' situations he's witnessed
description: Airlines including Emirates and Air India canceled flights over 5G safety concerns, though Verizon and AT&T later delayed the rollout near airports.

author: Juli Clover
title: Verizon Announces Plans to Expand 5G Ultra Wideband to 1,700 Cities in January, Offers Improved 5G Plans
description:
Verizon today announced plans to expand its 5G Ultra Wideband technology to more than 100 million people across 1,700 cities in the United States, offering 5G speeds that are up to 10x faster than 4G LTE speeds and that can hit up to one gigabit per second.

author: Juli Clover
title: AT&T and Verizon Now Rolling Out C-Band 5G Spectrum
description:
Following weeks of delays due to concerns from the aviation industry, Verizon and AT&T were today able to begin deploying C-Band 5G spectrum to improve the availability of 5G connectivity for users across the United States.
